intro: Cambessedesia semidecandra, commonly known as the Malabar thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in dry, rocky soils. Its leaves are alternate and simple, with a rough texture, while its flowers range in color from yellow to orange. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its propagation in natural habitats.
